ANNCR: Report from Japan! ( emphasis). A program of information
and commentary treating current issues in Japan. This program
is produced on tape recording in Tokyo. Here, now, is your
host: John Lerch.
MUSIC: THEME OUT
LERCH; This is our concluding Report from Japan, and we are very
fortunate to have as our guest, Mr. WiJIiam Woodard, director
of the International Institute for the Study of Religion^ Mr.
Woodard will inform us about the 2500th anniversary of the death
of Buddha* Let's turn attention right now, however, to some
items of general interest in the news.
MUSIC: DOCUMENTARY ( NEWSREEL) ESTABLISH UNDER.
ANNCR: Highlights in the News from Japan! Keio University receives
a generous Rockefeller Grant.
LERCH: The largestygrant in the Far East went toward restoration of
facilities of the School of Medicine at Keio University. The
Rockefeller Foundation grant of $290,000 will be matched by an
equal sum from the university^for rebuilding the School of
Medicine.
ANNCR: A solar heat cooker will make its debut in Japan soon.
LERCH: A solar heat cooker, completed by an Optical research
Institute in Tokyo is expected to make itsyfprpearance here.ap
The cooker, using a simple reflector to make use of the sun's
rays is designed to cook a small portion of rice in an hour.
It will sell for about $8.00 a unit, and should prove useful
in such fuel-short countries as India. A major drawback is
that it cannot be used at night or on rainy days!
